00047 
00048 typedef struct{
00049   u16 Header;
00050   u16 TrimValue;
00051 }SaveAutoTrim_TypeDef;
00052 
00053 #define SAVE_AUTO_TRIM_ADDRESS            (0x1FF00050)
00054 #define SAVE_AUTO_TRIM_HEAD_KEY           (0x5A5A)
00055 
00056 /* Global variables ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00057 __ALIGN4 USBDCore_TypeDef gUSBCore;
00058 USBD_Driver_TypeDef gUSBDriver;
00059 u32 gIsLowPowerAllowed = TRUE;
00060 bool bISTrimSaved = FALSE;
00061 u32 gTrimValue;
00062 
00063 /* Private function prototypes -----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00064 void CKCU_Configuration(void);
00065 void GPIO_Configuration(void);
00066 void USB_Configuration(void);
00067 void USBPLL_Configuration(void);
00068 void USBVRG_Configuration(void);
00069 void Suspend(u32 uPara);
00070 void CKCU_LoadTrimValue(void);
00071 void UpdateAutoTrimValue(void);
00072 void SysClockConfig_HSI(void);
00073 void SysClockConfig_PLL(void);
00074 #if (ENABLE_CKOUT == 1)
00075 void CKOUTConfig(void);
00076 #endif

00078 /* Global functions ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00079 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00080   * @brief  Main program.
00081   * @retval None
00082   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00083 int main(void)
00084 {
00085   CKCU_Configuration();               /* System Related configuration                                       */
00086   SysClockConfig_HSI();               /* Switch system clock source to HSI                                  */
00087   SysClockConfig_PLL();               /* PLL Related configuration                                          */
00088   GPIO_Configuration();               /* GPIO Related configuration                                         */
00089   RETARGET_Configuration();           /* Retarget Related configuration                                     */
00090   USB_Configuration();                /* USB Related configuration                                          */
00091 
00092   CKCU_LoadTrimValue();
00093 
00094 #if (ENABLE_CKOUT == 1)
00095   CKOUTConfig();
00096 #endif
00097 
00098   HT32F_DVB_USBConnect();
00099   while (1)
00100   {
00101     USBDCore_MainRoutine(&gUSBCore);  /* USB core main routine                                              */
00102     UpdateAutoTrimValue();            /* Update auto-trim value                                             */
00103   }
00104 }
00105 
00106 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00107   * @brief Configure system clock as PLL.
00108   * @retval None
00109   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00110 void SysClockConfig_PLL(void)
00111 {
00112   /* !!! NOTICE !!!
00113      Notice that the local variable (structure) did not have an initial value.
00114      Please confirm that there are no missing members in the parameter settings below in this function.
00115   */
00116   CKCU_PLLInitTypeDef PLL_InitStruct;
00117 
00118   #if (HTCFG_USE_HSE == 1)
00119   /* Enable HSE                                                                                             */
00120   CKCU_HSECmd(ENABLE);
00121   while (CKCU_GetClockReadyStatus(CKCU_FLAG_HSERDY) != SET);
00122   #else
00123   /* Enable HSI                                                                                             */
00124   CKCU_HSICmd(ENABLE);
00125   while (CKCU_GetClockReadyStatus(CKCU_FLAG_HSIRDY) != SET);
00126   #endif
00127 
00128   /* Inital PLL                                                                                             */
00129   PLL_InitStruct.BYPASSCmd = DISABLE;
00130   #if (LIBCFG_CKCU_SYS_CK_60M)
00131   PLL_InitStruct.CFG = CKCU_PLL_8M_60M;
00132   #else
00133   PLL_InitStruct.CFG = CKCU_PLL_8M_48M;
00134   #endif
00135   PLL_InitStruct.ClockSource = CKCU_PLLSRC_HSI; /* Switch the system clock source to HSI clock.             */
00136   CKCU_PLLInit(&PLL_InitStruct);
00137 
00138   /* Enable PLL                                                                                             */
00139   CKCU_PLLCmd(ENABLE);
00140 
00141   /* Wait until PLL is ready                                                                                */
00142   while (CKCU_GetClockReadyStatus(CKCU_FLAG_PLLRDY) == RESET);
00143 
00144   #if (LIBCFG_FMC_PREFETCH)
00145   /* FLASH wait state configuration                                                                         */
00146   FLASH_SetWaitState(FLASH_WAITSTATE_MAX);
00147   #endif
00148 
00149   /* Recovery CK_AHB prescaler setting if need                                                              */
00150   //CKCU_SetHCLKPrescaler(CKCU_SYSCLK_DIV1);                      /* set CK_AHB prescaler                   */
00151 
00152   /* Configure PLL as system clock                                                                          */
00153   CKCU_SysClockConfig(CKCU_SW_PLL);
00154 }
00155 
00156 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00157   * @brief Configure system clock as HSI.
00158   * @retval None
00159   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00160 void SysClockConfig_HSI(void)
00161 {
00162   /* Enable HSI                                                                                             */
00163   CKCU_HSICmd(ENABLE);
00164   while (CKCU_GetClockReadyStatus(CKCU_FLAG_HSIRDY) != SET);
00165 
00166   /* Configure HSI as system clock                                                                          */
00167   CKCU_SysClockConfig(CKCU_SW_HSI);
00168   CKCU_SetHCLKPrescaler(CKCU_SYSCLK_DIV1);                        /* set CK_AHB prescaler                   */
00169 
00170   #if (LIBCFG_FMC_PREFETCH)
00171   /* FLASH wait state configuration                                                                         */
00172   FLASH_SetWaitState(FLASH_WAITSTATE_0);     /* FLASH wait clock                                            */
00173   #endif
00174 
00175   CKCU_PLLCmd(DISABLE);                                           /* Disable PLL                            */
00176   CKCU_HSECmd(DISABLE);                                           /* Disable HSE                            */
00177 }
00178 
00179 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00180   * @brief  Update auto-trim value.
00181   * @retval None
00182   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00183 void UpdateAutoTrimValue(void)
00184 {
00185   /* 
00186     1. Check HSI auto-trim is ready.
00187     2. Check the Trim Value has saved to SAVE_AUTO_TRIM_ADDRESS. Avoid write to flash frequently. 
00188   */
00189   if(bISTrimSaved == TRUE)
00190   {
00191     return;
00192   }
00193   if (CKCU_HSIAutoTrimIsReady() == TRUE)
00194   {
00195     FLASH_State FLASHState;
00196     u32 uBuffer = 0;
00197     SaveAutoTrim_TypeDef *pSaveTrim = (SaveAutoTrim_TypeDef*)&uBuffer;
00198     pSaveTrim->TrimValue = (HT_CKCU->HSICR & 0x00FF0000) >> 16;
00199     pSaveTrim->Header = SAVE_AUTO_TRIM_HEAD_KEY;
00200     printf("Detect a new Trim Value...\r\n\t\t\tTrim Value : 0x%03X\r\n",pSaveTrim->TrimValue);
00201     printf("Save the new Trim Value...\r\n");
00202 
00203     if(gTrimValue == pSaveTrim->TrimValue)
00204     {
00205       /*If Trim Value isn't changed,The system will not write Trim value to data area. 
00206         The purpose is to reduce flash writes frequently.                                                      */
00207       FLASHState = FLASH_COMPLETE;
00208     }
00209     else
00210     {
00211       /* Write Trim Value to data area.                                                                        */
00212       FLASHState = FLASH_EraseOptionByte();
00213       if(FLASHState != FLASH_COMPLETE)
00214       {
00215         printf("\t\t\tErrase error : %d",FLASHState);
00216         bISTrimSaved = FALSE;
00217         return ;
00218       }
00219       FLASHState = FLASH_ProgramWordData(SAVE_AUTO_TRIM_ADDRESS, uBuffer);
00220     }
00221     if(FLASHState != FLASH_COMPLETE)
00222     {
00223       printf("\t\t\tProgram error : %d",FLASHState);
00224       bISTrimSaved = FALSE;
00225     }
00226     else
00227     {
00228       printf("\t\t\tFinish\r\n");
00229       bISTrimSaved = TRUE;
00230     }
00231   }
00232 }
00233 
00234 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00235   * @brief  Configure the system clocks.
00236   * @retval None
00237   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00238 void CKCU_LoadTrimValue(void)
00239 {
00240   SaveAutoTrim_TypeDef *pSaveTrim;
00241 
00242   /* Getting  the trim value from SAVE_AUTO_TRIM_ADDRESS                                                         */
00243   pSaveTrim = (SaveAutoTrim_TypeDef*) SAVE_AUTO_TRIM_ADDRESS;
00244 
00245   /* Check the trim value is valid                                                                               */
00246   if(pSaveTrim->Header != SAVE_AUTO_TRIM_HEAD_KEY)
00247   {
00248   /* the trim value isn't valid                                                                                  */
00249     gTrimValue = 0;
00250     return;
00251   }
00252   else
00253   {
00254   /* the trim value is valid, then reload the trim value to HSICR                                                */
00255     printf("Load the Trim Value...\r\n\t\t\tTrim Value : 0x%03X\r\n",pSaveTrim->TrimValue);
00256     gTrimValue = pSaveTrim->TrimValue;
00257     HT_CKCU->HSICR = ((pSaveTrim->TrimValue << 16) | (1ul << 4) | (1ul << 0));
00258   }
00259 }
00260 
00261 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00262   * @brief  Configure the system clocks.
00263   * @retval None
00264   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00265 void CKCU_Configuration(void)
00266 {
00267   CKCU_PeripClockConfig_TypeDef CKCUClock = {{ 0 }};
00268   CKCUClock.Bit.USBD                  = 1;
00269   CKCUClock.Bit.AFIO                  = 1;
00270   CKCUClock.Bit.EXTI                  = 1;
00271   CKCU_PeripClockConfig(CKCUClock, ENABLE);
00272 }
00273 
00274 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00275   * @brief  Configure the GPIO ports.
00276   * @retval None
00277   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00278 void GPIO_Configuration(void)
00279 {
00280   HT32F_DVB_PBInit(BUTTON_KEY1, BUTTON_MODE_GPIO);
00281   /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00282   /* Configure EXTI for Remote Wakeup                                                                       */
00283   /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00284   AFIO_EXTISourceConfig(KEY1_BUTTON_EXTI_CHANNEL, KEY1_BUTTON_GPIO_ID);
00285 }
00286 
00287 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00288   * @brief  Configure USB.
00289   * @retval None
00290   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00291 void USB_Configuration(void)
00292 {
00293   #if (LIBCFG_CKCU_USB_PLL)
00294   USBPLL_Configuration();
00295   #endif
00296 
00297   #if (LIBCFG_PWRCU_VREG)
00298   USBVRG_Configuration();                               /* Voltage of USB setting                           */
00299   #endif
00300 
00301   gUSBCore.pDriver = (u32 *)&gUSBDriver;                /* Initiate memory pointer of USB driver            */
00302   gUSBCore.Power.CallBack_Suspend.func  = Suspend;      /* Install suspend call back function into USB core */
00303   //gUSBCore.Power.CallBack_Suspend.uPara = (u32)NULL;
00304 
00305   USBDDesc_Init(&gUSBCore.Device.Desc);                 /* Initiate memory pointer of descriptor            */
00306   USBDClass_Init(&gUSBCore.Class);                      /* Initiate USB Class layer                         */
00307   USBDCore_Init(&gUSBCore);                             /* Initiate USB Core layer                          */
00308 
00309   /* !!! NOTICE !!!
00310      Must turn on if the USB clock source is from HSI (PLL clock Source)
00311   */
00312   #if 0
00313   { /* Turn on HSI auto trim function                                                                       */
00314     CKCU_HSIAutoTrimClkConfig(CKCU_ATC_USB);
00315     CKCU_HSIAutoTrimCmd(ENABLE);
00316   }
00317   #endif
00318 
00319   NVIC_EnableIRQ(USB_IRQn);                             /* Enable USB device interrupt                      */
00320 }
00321 
00322 #if (LIBCFG_CKCU_USB_PLL)
00323 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00324  * @brief  Configure USB PLL
00325  * @retval None
00326  ************************************************************************************************************/
00327 void USBPLL_Configuration(void)
00328 {
00329   { /* USB PLL configuration                                                                                */
00330 
00331     /* !!! NOTICE !!!
00332        Notice that the local variable (structure) did not have an initial value.
00333        Please confirm that there are no missing members in the parameter settings below in this function.
00334     */
00335     CKCU_PLLInitTypeDef PLLInit;
00336 
00337     PLLInit.ClockSource = CKCU_PLLSRC_HSI;  // CKCU_PLLSRC_HSE or CKCU_PLLSRC_HSI
00338     #if (LIBCFG_CKCU_USB_PLL_96M)
00339     PLLInit.CFG = CKCU_USBPLL_8M_96M;
00340     #else
00341     PLLInit.CFG = CKCU_USBPLL_8M_48M;
00342     #endif
00343     PLLInit.BYPASSCmd = DISABLE;
00344     CKCU_USBPLLInit(&PLLInit);
00345   }
00346 
00347   CKCU_USBPLLCmd(ENABLE);
00348 
00349   while (CKCU_GetClockReadyStatus(CKCU_FLAG_USBPLLRDY) == RESET);
00350   CKCU_USBClockConfig(CKCU_CKUSBPLL);
00351 }
00352 #endif
00353 
00354 #if (LIBCFG_PWRCU_VREG)
00355 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00356  * @brief  Configure USB Voltage 
00357  * @retval None
00358  ************************************************************************************************************/
00359 void USBVRG_Configuration(void)
00360 {
00361   CKCU_PeripClockConfig_TypeDef CKCUClock = {{ 0 }};
00362   CKCUClock.Bit.BKP                   = 1;
00363   CKCU_PeripClockConfig(CKCUClock, ENABLE);
00364 
00365   PWRCU_SetVREG(PWRCU_VREG_3V3);
00366 
00367   /* !!! NOTICE !!!
00368      USB LDO Should be enabled (PWRCU_VREG_ENABLE) if the MCU VDD > 3.6 V.
00369   */
00370   PWRCU_VREGConfig(PWRCU_VREG_BYPASS);
00371 }
00372 #endif
00373 
00374 #define REMOTE_WAKEUP      (1)
00375 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00376   * @brief  Suspend call back function which enter DeepSleep1
00377   * @param  uPara: Parameter for Call back function
00378   * @retval None
00379   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00380 void Suspend(u32 uPara)
00381 {
00382   #if (REMOTE_WAKEUP == 1)
00383   u32 IsRemoteWakeupAllowed;
00384   #endif
00385   if (gIsLowPowerAllowed)
00386   {
00387 
00388     #if (REMOTE_WAKEUP == 1)
00389     /* Disable EXTI interrupt to prevent interrupt occurred after wakeup                                    */
00390     EXTI_IntConfig(KEY1_BUTTON_EXTI_CHANNEL, DISABLE);
00391     IsRemoteWakeupAllowed = USBDCore_GetRemoteWakeUpFeature(&gUSBCore);
00392 
00393     if (IsRemoteWakeupAllowed == TRUE)
00394     {
00395       /* Enable EXTI wake event and clear wakeup flag                                                       */
00396       EXTI_WakeupEventConfig(KEY1_BUTTON_EXTI_CHANNEL, EXTI_WAKEUP_LOW_LEVEL, ENABLE);
00397       EXTI_ClearWakeupFlag(KEY1_BUTTON_EXTI_CHANNEL);
00398     }
00399     #endif
00400 
00401     __DBG_USBPrintf("%06ld >DEEPSLEEP\r\n", ++__DBG_USBCount);
00402 
00403     // Add your procedure here which disable related IO to reduce power consumption
00404     // ..................
00405     //
00406 
00407     if ((gUSBCore.Info.CurrentStatus == USB_STATE_SUSPENDED) && ((HT_USB->CSR & 0xC0) == 0x40))   // D+ = 1, D- = 0
00408     {
00409       /* For Bus powered device, you must enter DeepSleep1 when device has been suspended. For self-powered */
00410       /* device, you may decide to enter DeepSleep1 or not depended on your application.                    */
00411 
00412       /* For the convenient during debugging and evaluation stage, the USBDCore_LowPower() is map to a null */
00413       /* function by default. In the real product, you must map this function to the low power function of  */
00414       /* firmware library by setting USBDCORE_ENABLE_LOW_POWER as 1 (in the ht32fxxxx_usbdconf.h file).     */
00415       USBDCore_LowPower();
00416     }
00417 
00418     // Add your procedure here which recovery related IO for application
00419     // ..................
00420     //
00421 
00422     __DBG_USBPrintf("%06ld <DEEPSLEEP\r\n", ++__DBG_USBCount);
00423 
00424     #if (REMOTE_WAKEUP == 1)
00425     if (EXTI_GetWakeupFlagStatus(KEY1_BUTTON_EXTI_CHANNEL) == SET)
00426     {
00427       __DBG_USBPrintf("%06ld WAKEUP\r\n", ++__DBG_USBCount);
00428       if (IsRemoteWakeupAllowed == TRUE && USBDCore_IsSuspend(&gUSBCore) == TRUE)
00429       {
00430         USBDCore_TriggerRemoteWakeup();
00431       }
00432     }
00433 
00434     if (IsRemoteWakeupAllowed == TRUE)
00435     {
00436       /* Disable EXTI wake event and clear wakeup flag                                                      */
00437       EXTI_WakeupEventConfig(KEY1_BUTTON_EXTI_CHANNEL, EXTI_WAKEUP_LOW_LEVEL, DISABLE);
00438       EXTI_ClearWakeupFlag(KEY1_BUTTON_EXTI_CHANNEL);
00439     }
00440 
00441     /* Clear EXTI edge flag and enable EXTI interrupt                                                       */
00442     EXTI_ClearEdgeFlag(KEY1_BUTTON_EXTI_CHANNEL);
00443     EXTI_IntConfig(KEY1_BUTTON_EXTI_CHANNEL, ENABLE);
00444     #endif
00445   }
00446 
00447   return;
00448 }

00450 #if (ENABLE_CKOUT == 1)
00451 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00452   * @brief  Configure the debug output clock.
00453   * @retval None
00454   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00455 void CKOUTConfig(void)
00456 {
00457   { /* Enable peripheral clock                                                                              */
00458     CKCU_PeripClockConfig_TypeDef CKCUClock = {{ 0 }};
00459     CKCUClock.Bit.AFIO = 1;
00460     CKCU_PeripClockConfig(CKCUClock, ENABLE);
00461   }
00462 
00463   AFIO_GPxConfig(GPIO_PA, AFIO_PIN_9, AFIO_MODE_15);
00464 
00465   { /* Configure CKOUT                                                                                      */
00466     CKCU_CKOUTInitTypeDef CKOUTInit;
00467     CKOUTInit.CKOUTSRC = CKCU_CKOUTSRC_HCLK_DIV16;
00468     CKCU_CKOUTConfig(&CKOUTInit);
00469   }
00470 }
00471 #endif

00484      Debug message can be added here.
00485      Example: printf("Parameter Error: file %s on line %d\r\n", filename, uline);
00486   */
00487

00489   {
00490   }
00491 }
